provinces.name: Alberta
provinces.description: Alberta is a province in western Canada known for its diverse landscapes, including the Rocky Mountains, prairies, and forests. It is famous for its national parks and vibrant cities like Calgary and Edmonton.

provinces.name: British Columbia
provinces.description: British Columbia is a coastal province known for its stunning natural beauty, with the Pacific Ocean, mountains, and rainforests. Vancouver is its largest city.

provinces.name: Manitoba
provinces.description: Manitoba is a Canadian province known for its natural beauty, with over 100,000 lakes, forests, and diverse wildlife. Winnipeg is its capital city.

provinces.name: New Brunswick
provinces.description: New Brunswick is a maritime province known for its beautiful coastline, rich history, and cultural heritage. Fredericton is its capital city.

provinces.name: Newfoundland and Labrador
provinces.description: Newfoundland and Labrador is the easternmost province of Canada, known for its rugged coastlines, icebergs, and rich cultural history. St. John's is its capital city.

provinces.name: Nova Scotia
provinces.description: Nova Scotia is a maritime province known for its stunning coastal scenery, historic towns, and vibrant culture. Halifax is its capital city.

provinces.name: Ontario
provinces.description: Ontario is the most populous province in Canada and home to Toronto, its largest city. It's known for its diverse culture, industry, and natural beauty.

provinces.name: Prince Edward Island
provinces.description: Prince Edward Island is a maritime province known for its beautiful beaches, red sandstone cliffs, and charming villages. Charlottetown is its capital city.

provinces.name: Quebec
provinces.description: Quebec is a French-speaking province in Canada known for its rich history, culture, and diverse landscapes, including the St. Lawrence River. Quebec City is its capital.

provinces.name: Saskatchewan
provinces.description: Saskatchewan is a prairie province known for its wide-open spaces, beautiful lakes, and outdoor recreational activities. Regina is its capital city.
